author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the following guidelines for auto-merging:

- Name does not meet all of the following: starts with a capital letter, ASCII alphanumerics only, ends in lowercase
- Name is not at least five characters long
- Version number is not 0.0.1, 0.1.0, or 1.0.0
- The following dependencies do not have a compat entry that has an upper bound: Interpolations, Polynomials, StatsBase, julia. You may find [CompatHelper](https://github.com/bcbi/CompatHelper.jl) helpful for keeping your compat entries up-to-date.Note: If your package works for the current version `x.y.z` of a dependency `foo`, then a compat entry `foo = x.y.z` implies a compatibility upper bound for packages following semver. You can additionally include earlier versions your package is compatible with. See https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/v1/compatibility/ for details.

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

[noblock]

Can you add the compat entries please? I recommend using CompatHelper.
Perhaps a more descriptive name would be better? How about `DCCACoefficients.jl`?
Here's another idea for a name: `DCCAnalysis.jl`
Bump @johncwok Any thoughts on a better, more descriptive package name?

Bump.

I cannot merge this pull request with the current name `DCCA`.

I’ll leave this open for two more weeks. If another registry maintainer has not merged it by then, I’ll close this.

> Bump.
> 
> I cannot merge this pull request with the current name `DCCA`.
> 
> I’ll leave this open for two more weeks. If another registry maintainer has not merged it by then, I’ll close this.

It has been two weeks and no other registry maintainer has merged this.
